message_1:
Given a message "MATH" and the key matrix:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
2 & 5 \\
1 & 3 
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Use the Hill Cipher to encrypt the message into a four-digit numerical code.
message_2:
To encrypt the message "MATH" using the Hill Cipher, we first need to convert the letters into numerical values using the following mapping: A=0, B=1, ..., Z=25. 

M = 12
A = 0
T = 19
H = 7

Now, we need to arrange the message into a matrix form. Since the key matrix is 2x2, we will arrange the message into a 2x2 matrix:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
12 & 19 \\
0 & 7 
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Next, we multiply the key matrix by the message matrix:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
2 & 5 \\
1 & 3 
\end{bmatrix}
\times
\begin{bmatrix}
12 & 19 \\
0 & 7 
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
2(12) + 5(0) & 2(19) + 5(7) \\
1(12) + 3(0) & 1(19) + 3(7) 
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
24 & 59 \\
12 & 40 
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Now, we need to take the result modulo 26 to get the encrypted message:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
24 \mod{26} & 59 \mod{26} \\
12 \mod{26} & 40 \mod{26} 
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
24 & 7 \\
12 & 14 
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Finally, we convert the numerical values back to letters:

X = 24
H = 7
M = 12
O = 14

The encrypted message is "XHMO". To represent this as a four-digit numerical code, we can use the original numerical values: 24071214.
